title: Pete Wylie - The Handy Wah! Whole
description:
Pete Wylie started as one of the "Crucial three", a band with Pete, Julian Cope and Ian McCulloch. However, three huge ego&#039;s were way too much to fit in one band and the band exploded without ever releasing an album after having existed one month in 1977. Supposedly only four tracks were recorded. 

Pete then spent his entire carreer in different incarnations of Wah!, using different names like "The mighty wah!" or "Wah! the mongrel", all bands having one thing in common: They&#039;re Pete Wylie with a group of musicians. 

In 1987 Pete released an album using his own name for once which instantly brought him a few UK top 40 hits with "Sinful" and "Diamond girl". After this album he went back releasing music as Wah! with or without additions. 

In 2003 Pete, self acclaimed &#039;Part time rockstar, full time legend&#039;, bitterly announced his retirement from the music business, however he does still perform  occasionly. One thing, this is a-two-CD compilation but CD one is missing in action! If I find it, I&#039;ll add another torrent. Pete Wylie fans, enjoy this and seed please.


Tracklisting:

01 Sinful  
02 Diamond Girl  
03 If I Love You  
04 Never Fall for a Whore  
05 Four Eleven Forty Four   
06 Pete Wylie and Wah! the Mongrel - Don&#039;t Lose Your Dreams (Excerpt from a      
   Teenage Opera), Pt. 154  
07 Pete Wylie and Wah! the Mongrel - Circle of Salt  
08 Pete Wylie and Wah! the Mongrel - Kerry Baby  
09 Pete Wylie and Wah! the Mongrel - Long Tall Scally (The Ballad Thereof)  
10 Pete Wylie and Wah! the Mongrel - Getting Out of It...  
11 The Mighty Wah! - Heart as Big as Liverpool
